Oh! But that is why I love him... I used to think of him as 
a "filler", a cameo... Actually I thought the same about Tetsu, 
probably because I started watching only to see the Shinsengumi 
bishies ^_^ Back to Suzu, it's so obvious that there's promise in 
his character. I just hope like you, that the writers handle the 
whole thing correctly. Right now if the anime continued, he'd be the 
guy hating both the Ishin-shishis and the Miburos, which is why he's 
so interesting. Which way will he go? What is the alternate route?

Ah! Yes.. I remember you posted that tour... I think I forgot about 
it since I didn't have decent internet connection back then... Will 
go and see...

Thanks for trying to find out... From the stuff that I read it said 
it started with SIP not PMK. Miss Barbara took it a step further and 
said PMK is ongoing and just past the Ikeda-ya incident... I will 
check Fifay.net too....




--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Tiffany" <tnamwong@h...> wrote:
> Really? Suzu?  I used to feel sorry for him too but now I feel 
kind of
> scared of him 0_O  I think the writers have to show some real skill
> and not just rely on the "you killed my teacher" excuse (which was
> parodied in Kill Bill Vol. 2)...PMK, I love it I love it, but 
there is
> sooo much of the evil twin model.  Yoshida is the evil twin for
> Hijikata, Okita has an evil twin, and Susu is Tetsu's evil twin...I
> know even RK  kind of has the evil twin model but in PMK it is very
> very pronounced.
> 
> I saw your Maekawa residence pics...there is an actual tour you can
> download at http://www.the-shinsengumi.com/ (the link is in the 
middle
> of the sword)...and they show the floorboards the rooms etc and the
> tour guides act like they are all scared etc...funny

address
